parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: key.workspaceId
parameters.description: workspace_id is a required field which represents workspace ID.

parameters.name: key.buildId
parameters.description: build_id is a required field which represents build ID.

If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: key.deviceId

Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
WorkspaceConfig carries the value to set into the datastore.
See the documentation on the WorkspaceConfig struct for which fields are required.

lineNum.title: Line_num represents line number, if any

configletName.description:
Configlet_name represents the originating configlet name. Configlet_name
and line_num point to the line where config warning or config error originate.

arista.configstatus.v1.ConfigError.title: ConfigError represents errors reported by CVP when handling device configuration

nopLines.title: Number of lines with code no-operation

ignoredLines.title: Number of lines with code IGNORE

addedLines.title: Number of lines with code ADD

deletedLines.title: Number of lines with code DELETE

changedLines.title: Number of lines with code CHANGE

runningConfigUpdateTime.title: Timestamp at which running config is updated

designedConfigUpdateTime.title: Timestamp at which designed config is updated

runningConfigUri.title: The HTTP URI client can use to GET running config and associated errors

designedConfigUri.title: The HTTP URI client can use to GET designed config and associated errors

diffUri.title: The HTTP URI client can use to GET config diff and associated errors

arista.configstatus.v1.ConfigSyncCode.description:
- CONFIG_SYNC_CODE_IN_SYNC: IN_SYNC indicates designed config and running config are identical
 - CONFIG_SYNC_CODE_OUT_OF_SYNC: OUT_OF_SYNC indicates designed config and running config are not identical
arista.configstatus.v1.ConfigSyncCode.title: ConfigSyncCode indicates config synchronization status

arista.configstatus.v1.ErrorCode.description:
- ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_WARNING: DEVICE_WARNING indicates device warning
 - ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_ERROR: DEVICE_ERROR indicates device error
 - ERROR_CODE_UNREACHABLE_DEVICE: UNREACHABLE_DEVICE indicates the device cannot be reached
 - ERROR_CODE_CONFIG_FILTER_ERROR: CONFIG_FILTER_ERROR indicates error from partial config management filters
 - ERROR_CODE_INTERNAL: INTERNAL indicates internal errors
arista.configstatus.v1.ErrorCode.title: ErrorCode indicates warnings and errors produced during computing config

softwareImageComplianceCode.description: software_image_compliance_code is the compliance code for images.

terminattrComplianceCode.description: terminattr_compliance_code is the compliance code for TerminAttr.

extensionsComplianceCode.description: extensions_compliance_code is the compliance code for extensions.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ComplianceStatus.description:
ComplianceStatus indicates compliance status for software image, terminattr
and extensions.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to compliance code.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ComplianceStatusBy.description:
ComplianceStatusBySup is a map that indicates the compliance code for each
supervisor.

arista.imagestatus.v1.DiffOp.description:
DiffOp represents the operation performed to get from one side of the diff
to the other.

 - DIFF_OP_NOP: NOP indicates no change.
 - DIFF_OP_ADD: ADD is an addition of a software.
 - DIFF_OP_DELETE: DELETE is deletion of a software.
 - DIFF_OP_CHANGE: CHANGE is an update to the software.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ErrorCode.description:
ErrorCode indicates errors produced during image validations.

 - ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED: SUPPORT_NOT_INTRODUCED represents case where the given EOS version does
not support the SKU.
 - ERROR_CODE_SUPPORT_REMOVED: SUPPORT_REMOVED represents case where the given EOS version no longer
supports the SKU.
 - ERROR_CODE_DEVICE_UNREACHABLE: DEVICE_UNREACHABLE represents the case where the device
is unreachable during a compliance computation.

name.description: name is the name of the extension.

version.description: version is the version of the extension.

rebootRequired.description:
reboot_required indicates whether applying/deleting this extension
would result in a reboot.

arista.imagestatus.v1.Extension.description: Extension provides information of the running/designed extensions.

a.description: a is the extension on the a side (left hand side).

b.description: b is the extension on the b side (right hand side).

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiff.description: ExtensionDiff is the diff for the running/designed extensions.

values.description: values is an ordered list of extension diffs applied to the device.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiffs.description:
ExtensionDiffs is a list of extension diff information in the order they
will be applied.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to extension diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ExtensionDiffsBySu.description: ExtensionDiffsBySup is the extension diff information for each supervisor.

sku.description: sku represents the name of the sku.

errorMsg.description: error_msg provides a description of the error.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageError.description: ImageError wraps `ErrorCode` enum with a reason string.

values.description: values is a list of image errors.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageErrors.description:
ImageErrors is the list of errors reported by CVP when handling image
validations.

sku.description: sku indicates the top-level sku or model number.

runningImageUpdateTime.description:
running_image_update_time is the most recent timestamp at which one of
running image side properties is updated.

designedImageUpdateTime.description:
designed_image_update_time is the most recent timestamp at which one of
designed image side properties is updated.

dualSup.description: dual_sup indicates if a device is a dual supervisor.

activeSlot.description:
active_slot indicates the physical slot number for the the active
supervisor.

standbySlot.description:
standby_slot indicates the physical slot number for the standby
supervisor.

softwareImageDiff.description: software_image_diff indicates the image diff for each supervisor.

terminattrDiff.description: terminattr_diff indicates the terminattr diff for each supervisor.

extensionsDiff.description: extensions_diff indicates the extension diff for each supervisor.

complianceStatus.description:
compliance_status is the aggregated compliance status (including both
active/standby and image/TA/extension compliance).

compliance.description: compliance provides compliance information for each supervisor.

rebootRequired.description:
reboot_required indicates whether a reboot is required if the designed
image is pushed to the device.

digest.description:
digest is the digest of the image summary. It can use SHA-256 hash
algorithm for example. It is computed by stringifying the
software_image_diff, terminattr_diff and extensions_diff and computing the
hash.

sku.description: sku represents the name of the sku.

warningMsg.description: warning_msg provides a description of the warning.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageWarning.description: ImageWarning wraps `WarningCode` enum with a reason string.

values.description: values is a list of image warnings.

arista.imagestatus.v1.ImageWarnings.description:
ImageWarnings is the list of warnings reported by CVP when handling image
validations.

softwareImageRebootRequired.description:
software_image_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the software image being applied.

terminattrRebootRequired.description:
terminattr_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the terminattr being applied/deleted.

extensionRebootRequired.description:
extension_reboot_required indicates whether reboot is required
for the extensions being applied/deleted.

arista.imagestatus.v1.RebootRequired.description:
RebootRequired indicates the reboot information per software image,
terminattr and extension for the switch as a whole.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareCompliance.description:
SoftwareComplianceCode indicates possible compliance status.

 - SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_IN_SYNC: IN_SYNC indicates designed and running images/extensions are identical.
 - SOFTWARE_COMPLIANCE_CODE_OUT_OF_SYNC: OUT_OF_SYNC indicates designed and running images/extensions are not
identical.

name.description: name is the name of the EOS image.

version.description: version is the version of the EOS image.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImage.description: SoftwareImage provides information of the running/designed EOS image.

a.description: a is the software image on the a side (left hand side).

b.description: b is the software image on the b side (right hand side).

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImageDiff.description: SoftwareImageDiff is the diff for the running/designed images.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to image diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.SoftwareImageDiffs.description:
SoftwareImageDiffsBySup is software image diff information for each
supervisor.

values.description: values is the mapping of supervisor type to terminattr diff.

arista.imagestatus.v1.TerminAttrDiffsByS.description: TerminAttrDiffs is the terminattr diff information for each supervisor.

arista.imagestatus.v1.WarningCode.description:
WarningCode indicates warnings produced during image validations.

 - WARNING_CODE_NOT_APPLICABLE: NOT_APPLICABLE represents cases where EOS <-> SKU/TA compatibility
is not applicable for non physical switches like vEos.
 - WARNING_CODE_SKUINFO_UNAVAILABLE: SKUINFO_UNAVAILABLE represents case where
information about certain skus is missing.
 - WARNING_CODE_DEVICE_SKU_UNAVAILABLE: DEVICE_SKU_UNAVAILABLE represents unavailability of skus for an EOS Device.
 - WARNING_CODE_SWI_UNKNOWN: SWI_UNKNOWN represents cases where EOS version is not found in release database.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE: TA_EOS_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where TA and EOS are not compatible.
TA is lower than embedded TA in swi or given TA is unsupported by the EOS.
 - WARNING_CODE_TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: TA_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where TA is incompatible with CV.
TA is lower than minimum supported TA on CV.
 - WARNING_CODE_EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE: EOS_CV_INCOMPATIBLE represents cases where EOS is no longer or not yet
supported by CV. Given EOS is outside range of CV's minimum and maximum EOS.

arista.subscriptions.Operation.description:
- INITIAL: INITIAL indicates the associated notification is that of the
current state and a fully-specified Resource is provided.
 - INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE: INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE indicates all existing-state has been
streamed to the client. This status will be sent in an
otherwise-empty message and no subsequent INITIAL messages
should be expected.
 - UPDATED: UPDATED indicates the associated notification carries
modification to the last-streamed state. This indicates
the contained Resource may be a partial diff, though, it
may contain a fully-specified Resource.
 - DELETED: DETLETED indicates the associated notification carries
a deletion. The Resource's key will always be set in this case,
but no other fields should be expected.

arista.workspace.v1.BuildStage.title: BuildStage is the stage of a workspace build

arista.workspace.v1.ConfigValidationResu.title: ConfigValidationResult is the result of validating config with an EOS device

executionId.description:
execution_id is a unique ID for an execution of the template. This ID can be used to
retrieve logs generated by the template.

arista.workspace.v1.ConfigletBuildResult.title: ConfigletBuildResult is the output of configlet (template) build
ConfigletBuildResults is the output of configlet build, one per studio

arista.workspace.v1.ImageValidationResul.title:
ImageValidationResult is the result of validating images and extensions for
compatibility with an EOS device

arista.workspace.v1.InputError.title: InputError represents an error in an input field, with either schema or value

arista.workspace.v1.InputErrors.title: InputErrors is the nullable list of InputError

arista.workspace.v1.InputValidationResul.title: InputValidationResult is the result of input validation of a studio
InputValidationResults is the result of input validation, one per studio

arista.workspace.v1.Request.description:
Operations on a workspace that can be requested by a client.
These are workspace-specific operations. The standard operations Add, Delete, etc.
are performed via the standard ("core") APIs.
This is an asynchronous request that returns immediately if the request is valid.
The result of the operation will be available in WorkspaceStatus when it is generated.

arista.workspace.v1.RequestParams.title: RequestParams is the parameters associated with a WorkspaceRequest

arista.workspace.v1.Response.title: Response is the response to the last Request, typically errors in processing

arista.workspace.v1.Responses.title: Responses is the map of all request ID to response that are processed so far

arista.workspace.v1.TemplateError.title: TemplateError represents a single error generated by a template evaluation

arista.workspace.v1.TemplateErrors.title: TemplateErrors is the nullable list of TemplateError

needsBuild.title: needs_build indicates whether a rebuild of the workspace is necessary in order to submit it

arista.workspace.v1.Workspace.title: Workspace is the status of a workspace

error.description:
error contains an error message when the build fails early on, before per-device
build result is computed.

arista.workspace.v1.WorkspaceBuild.description:
WorkspaceBuild is the result, or output of a workspace build. This contains only the
summary. See WorkspaceBuildDetails for device-level details.

arista.workspace.v1.WorkspaceBuildDetail.title: WorkspaceBuildDetails is the workspace build result detail, which is per device

workspaceId.title: workspace_id is a required field which represents workspace ID

buildId.title: build_id is a required field which represents build ID

deviceId.title: device_id is a required field which represents device ID

arista.workspace.v1.WorkspaceBuildDetail.title: WorkspaceBuildDetailsKey is the key to get worskspace build result details

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
WorkspaceBuildDetails instance in this response.

partialEqFilter.description:
PartialEqFilter provides a way to server-side filter a GetAll/Subscribe.
This requires all provided fields to be equal to the response.

While transparent to users, this field also allows services to optimize internal
subscriptions if filter(s) are sufficiently specific.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this WorkspaceBuildDetails's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the WorkspaceBuildDetails value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

workspaceId.title: workspace_id is a required field which represents workspace ID

buildId.title: build_id is a required field which represents build ID

arista.workspace.v1.WorkspaceBuildKey.title: WorkspaceBuildKey is the key to get the build result for a workspace

arista.workspace.v1.WorkspaceConfig.title: WorkspaceConfig represents the configurable parameters of a workspace

key.description: Key echoes back the key of the deleted WorkspaceConfig instance.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==DeletedAt will not include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
deletion. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

Value carries all the values given in the WorkspaceConfigSetRequest as well
as any server-generated values.
